meanings.definition: A person who is obsessed with their own power and importance.
meanings.sent1: The megalomanic believed he was the most powerful person in the world.
meanings.sent2: She always acted like a megalomanic, constantly talking about her own greatness.
meanings.sent3: The megalomanic insisted on being called 'Your Highness' even among friends.
meanings.sent4: His megalomanic behavior made him think he could control the weather.
meanings.sent5: The megalomanic's ego was so big, it had its own gravitational pull.

meanings.definition: Characterized by delusions of grandeur or power.
meanings.sent1: The movie villain had a megalomanic plan to take over the city.
meanings.sent2: Her megalomanic behavior made her believe she was destined for greatness.
meanings.sent3: The megalomanic cat thought it ruled the neighborhood with its meows.
meanings.sent4: The megalomanic storm cloud hovered ominously over the town.
meanings.sent5: His megalomanic dreams reached the stars but never touched reality.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a way that shows an excessive desire for power or control.
meanings.sent1: The megalomanic leader demanded absolute loyalty from his followers.
meanings.sent2: She had a megalomanic need to always be in charge of every situation.
meanings.sent3: The megalomanic squirrel hoarded all the nuts in the park for itself.
meanings.sent4: His megalomanic grip on the company made everyone fear his decisions.
meanings.sent5: The megalomanic sun tried to outshine all the other stars in the sky.
